Class controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller

  • public class controller
extends java.lang.Object
    The controller class acts as a GUI in order to handle user events. This class is running until the program is terminated. This class allows us to add and remove students as well as display all current students with their calculated tuition.

    • Method Detail

      • enableFundsInput

        public void enableFundsInput()
        When the funding checkbox is selected allows editing the funds.

      • instateSelect

        public void instateSelect()
        When instate radio button is selected disable the rest.

      • outstateSelect

        public void outstateSelect()
        When outstate radio button is selected disable the rest.

      • internationalSelect

        public void internationalSelect()
        When international radio button is selected disable the rest.

      • add

        public void add()
        The add function adds a student to the student list after checking that all fields were correctly entered and that the student doesn't exist in the list already.

      • remove

        public void remove()
        The remove method removes a student from the student list, unless the student is not an actual member. If member exists, it removes him and the last item in the array replaces it's position.

      • print

        public void print()
        The print method outputs all students in the list. If the team is empty it displays that it has 0 students.

      • checkParse

        public int checkParse(java.lang.String string)
        Checks if the string entered is in the correct format to be parsed as an integer. If it is, returns the parsed int, if not returns -1.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to be checked. Catches NumberFormatException if string contains chars
        Returns:
        int => the parsed int, or -1 if not valid.
